snippet: There is no reason professional football players should be immune from modern standards of workplace conduct.
abstract: Editorial maintains there is no reason that professional football players should be immune from modern standards of workplace conduct, citing season tainted by on-field racial slurs and bullying scandal; welcomes new regulations meant to improve conduct, but argues there must also be an upward shift in society's expectations for athletes.
lead_paragraph: There is no reason professional football players should be immune from modern standards of workplace conduct.

headline.main: The N.F.L. Begins to Wake Up
headline.print_headline: The N.F.L. Begins to Wake Up
